text: Falls from low grey clouds. Down below we see...
Muddy, slow and powerful, overflowing its banks. In the n distance is...
Filled to the maximum, water thundering out of two open g We close in on...
There's a Dam Control Office in the middle of the dam. We MOVE OFF the reservoir and head out over...
We see "NO FEAR" spelled out in stones on one man's roof. go down and into...
Storefronts are sandbagged and closed. A sign on one stor reads: GONE FISHING. A sign on another: HEY LOOTER. NOTHI OF VALUE HERE. TRY NEXT DOOR. And on the next store: HE'S LYING.
Beautiful, old, ringed with a five-foot-high wall of sand The floodwater is up to the first level of sandbags.
Loaded down, are heading out of town on streets covered i the first water of the flood.
On an island in the middle of the street. It's Civil War- era, of a general on a horse, sword held high. The floodw is over the curb, lapping at the base of statue's pedesta Near the statue stands...
50s, with soft edges and friendly eyes. He's talking into his radio mike.
So, are we all going to die?
HANK, the dam control officer, is on the radio with the  Sheriff.
Not right now. But I'm gonna have to  let out a little more.
WAYNE and PHIL, two deputies, 30s, are near the Sheriff,  shoring up a sandbag wall that has partially collapsed.
I think my best was when I turned  twelve. My Dad set up a treasure  hunt. It was really cool. (off Wayne's disdainful  look) Well, it was.
Wayne shrugs a "whatever" and pulls a sandbag up out of t water. There's unpleasant-looking muck all over his arms. drops the sandbag back into the water and shakes off the  crud with disgust.
This blows.
My most awful birthday was sweet  sixteen. I had mono. How about you?  What was your worst?
You kidding? You think I could've  possibly had a birthday worse than  this? What kind of loser do you think  I am?
Don't answer that, Phil.
The Sheriff walks over.
Hank says he's gonna open another  gate. We're gonna get another rise.
They turn at the sound of honking. The MAYOR drives up.
Gentlemen. Hey -- happy birthday,  Wayne.
Wayne nods. Phil stiffens. They do not like this guy.
(to the Sheriff) Mike, I gotta say, what you're  doing... I don't know if I'd be here,  considering.
(good-natured) Well, you would be if you wanted to  get the last couple of paychecks  some bastard owed you.
(grins, then:) I just want you to know I think the  people 'round here made a big mistake.
Phil grumbles to himself.
"The people"? You're the one who  screwed him.
Sorry, Phil?
(blushes) I, uh --
(to Mayor, saving  Phil) You know, Bob, as much as I'd love  to stand here all day talking about  how great I am, if you don't get  moving I'm gonna have to haul your  sorry ass off to jail.
(laughs) Okay, okay, I'm going. Keep up the  good work, boys. It's appreciated.
The Mayor rolls up his window and heads off.
Whaddya say we go torch the fucker's  house and blame it on looters. Or  how about we put a dead cow in his  living room. He comes back after  it's been in the water a couple of  days. Hello!

(shakes head) You wanna know how to get the best  revenge on the Mayor and his boys?  You do exactly what we're doing. You  protect the town. You protect it  better than they would. Better than  they ever could.
(thinks, shrugs) I think the dead cow's better.
(ignores Wayne) Any looter that comes in here is in  for a big surprise, cause as long as  I'm still wearing this pointy thing... (indicates badge) ...nobody's taking anything from  this town.
Nervous assistant bank manager WELLMAN is hurriedly tossi stacks of money into two canvas bags.
Washes up on Wellman.
Do you think you could go a little  faster, pal?
I -- I'm going as fast as I can.
Well, it's not fast enough.
Wellman is about to speak, then sees something, gulps.
Is held by one of the men, pointed at the floor.
Sweeps the money off the shelves and into the bags.
That it?
Yes. We don't keep any of our --
Ignore Wellman, grab the canvas bags and stride off.
CLOSE ON the lower half of the front doors as they fly op Out come TWO MEN in long dark raincoats.
Runs up, stopping in the open door.
Hey, wait!
As they slowly turn to face Wellman. We just see their fa shielded from the rain by hat brims. Meet...
Tom, 30, handsome, with an easy smile. Charlie, 50, with tough, red face.
Excuse me?
Looks nervous for a second, then holds up a clipboard.
You forgot to sign.

We see, for the first time, by their hats and uniforms, t they are armored car drivers. There's an armored car park at the curb, on the other side of a low wall of sandbags. Charlie sighs, goes back to Wellman and perfunctorily sig the form. Then he and Tom go to the sandbag wall. Tom hol both bags in one hand and the shotgun in the other. Charl doesn't want to get wet. He steps from the sandbag wall onto the rear bumper of th truck, then keys open the doors.
Okay.
Charlie reaches out for the money bags. Tom jumps off the sandbag wall and lands in the water, splashing Charlie.
For Christsakes!
It's a flood, Charlie. You're gonna  get wet.
Charlie takes the bags, tosses them in then shuts the bac He moves toward the front, still trying to keep out of th water. Tom splashes him some more.
Hey! Do you know what kind of crap  is in that water?
(of course he knows) Well, yeah.
Tom kicks some more water at Charlie. Charlie gives Tom a withering look and climbs in the truck.
Charlie gets into the driver's seat; Tom climbs into the  shotgun seat. They shut and bolt the doors. Charlie gets the radio.
Dispatch, this is 31.
Go ahead, 31.
We're leaving Huntingburg. We'll be  back in an hour.
Ten-four. Get out of there.
We're gone. Over and out.
Charlie hangs up the radio. He starts writing on a clipbo Silence for a few moments, and then Charlie notices Tom  staring at him.
What?
Your ear.
What about my ear?
You've got a major hair growth going  on.
Shut up.
I'm serious. You're gonna need  somebody to go in there with a weed  whacker.
Charlie grabs a donut bag off the seat and tosses it to T
Here.
You're offering me one of your donuts?  I don't know what to say. I'm getting  all misty.
If it'll shut your mouth you can  have the whole bag.
Charlie starts the truck. Tom thinks about it, then tosse the bag back.
Nah. I start eating donuts and I'll  never get out of this truck.
(disgusted) I love how you think you're better  than this.
Don't get me wrong, Charlie. There's  a lot to like about this job -- and  I don't just mean the dashing  polyester ensemble and the solid  three-figure income.
(angry) You ungrateful shit! I don't believe  you!
(surprised) Charlie, relax! I was kidding!
You don't wanna do this? Fine. Go  back to selling hot construction  machinery. That's a helluva career.
It had better hours.
Charlie slams the clipboard down on the seat.
You think this is a joke? This is  funny? Jesus Christ! You know how  lucky you are you could get in here?  Thirty years old and all the crap  you pulled and you never got caught?
(angry) That wasn't luck, old man. That was  skill. I was good at it.
Oh, yeah, it takes a lot of skill to  fence bulldozers. That's goddamn  genius time.
About as much skill as it takes to  sit in a truck and get fat eating  donuts.
Oh, so that's all I've been doing,  huh? Just wasting my life away.
I didn't say that.
Yeah, building a home, raising a  family -- that's just stupid.
I didn't say that!
You know what, Tom? I really don't  give a shit what you said.
Tom doesn't reply. Charlie puts the truck in gear; starts off. Tom looks at Charlie, shakes his head -- what was th about?
Writing letters in a crossword puzzle. Holding the pen is
Late 50s, with a creased face and piercing eyes. He's sit at the bar, drinking coffee. Rain sheets down outside. Th BARTENDER watches TV, sound off. Next to Jim at the bar a

Ray, 40s, has lank hair, rheumy eyes and a glass of Irish whisky in front of him. Kenny, 20s, long hair, has the en of a puppy -- unfortunately he has about as much smarts a puppy. Mr. Mehlor. 40s, looks like -- and was -- a high s teacher.
Sound off, a MAN is crying about what he has lost in the  flood.
"Thus saith the Lord; Behold, waters  shall rise up out of the north and  be an overflowing flood and all the  inhabitants of the land shall howl."  Jeremiah 47:2.
Ray takes a drink. Kenny leans over to Ray, sotto.
You're gonna be able to buy a helluva  lot of bibles, huh, Ray? Me? First  thing I'm gonna do is get my brother  a lawyer. Best that money can buy.
A thought comes to Jim -- an answer to a clue in the cros and he starts filling in words as Ray and Kenny talk.
What's he facing?
Thirty in.
He cap a cop or something...?
Security guard. "In the commission..."  All he's got is a piece of shit P.D.  Now I'm gonna be able to afford him  a good lawyer -- a guy with a haircut.
Jim leans over to Kenny.
'Scuse me a second. Take a look at  thirty-one across.
Jim slides the newspaper in front of Kenny.
Shit, Jim. I don't do crossword  puzzles.
I'll take a look, Jim.
Kenny can read. (to Kenny) Just look at it. You know when you  write down a word and suddenly it  looks all wrong? Maybe it's right,  but it doesn't look right?
Jim points at the newspaper.
Thirty-one across.
Kenny shrugs and looks down at the newspaper.
(mumbles as he reads) Mention money again and...
His eyes go wide.
In an uncompleted part of the puzzle, Jim has written a  message in the boxes. It reads: MENTION MONEY AND I'LL KI YOU.
Kenny looks up at Jim. Jim glances over at the bartender  then back at Kenny. Understand?
Did I get it right?
Yeah, Jim. You got it right.
Charlie and Tom continue to drive in silence. They both s looks at each other. Their eyes meet for a second, then t look away. A moment's pause then...
Jerk.
Jack-ass.
A hint of a smile on both of them. Tom reaches for Charli
Give us a kiss. Come on.
Charlie goes red in the face, pushes Tom away.
Get out of here.
(laughs, beat) You really are a cranky old fart,  you know that?
I'm sorry.
What was that about? I mean, I'm  just sitting here and all of a sudden  you go postal on me.
I don't know, I... It's just this  weather. I... I want to get back.
You know, I really do appreciate  what you've done for me. This is a  good job.
No, it's not. It stinks. It's putting  your life on the line for someone  else's money.
Looking away from town, the HIGH SCHOOL is on the left. O the right is the CEMETERY. Farther on, on the left, is a AND BOAT DEALERSHIP. The road is covered in water.
Goes by the entrance to the high school, water shooting u from the wheels, pushing out in a wide wake.
Tom glances ahead and sees that the road is covered in wa
Jesus. Where's the road?
Stretching out ahead of them are reflector bars on the  telephone poles, a few feet above the rippling surface of the floodwater.
It's there. (beat) Somewhere. I hope. (beat) Look, Tom, I don't care what it is  you end up doing.
Oh, God, here we go again.
This is the last time, I swear.
Tom sees something ahead. He doesn't understand at first.
The reflector bar on the pole two poles ahead is lower th the others. No reflector bars for a hundred yards, then t resume.
(looks at Tom) I just think, whatever it is you do,  it's time you did some heavy lifting.
Tom figures out what's going on with the reflector bars.
Stop!
No, you gotta hear this. You're better  than --
Stop the truck! We're going down!
The water rises fast up the grille as the truck angles do
Jesus!
Charlie stands on the brakes.
A wave of water rushes forward from the truck, then comes back and washes over the hood, splashing up on the windsh
Back up!

Charlie throws the truck into reverse but gives it too mu power. They hear the rear wheels spinning underwater. Cha eases off, the tires start to catch, they start moving  backwards. Charlie and Tom exchange a quick look of relief... and th the engine dies. Charlie tries to restart it, but there's nothing.

It's stopped on a downgrade -- it's a dip in the road. The water is up to the top of the front tires: up to the  hubcaps on the rear wheels. The headlights are underwater spots of yellow glowing. They've stopped next to a lighte sign.
HOME OF THE 1987 STATE CHAMPION WARRIORS.
Goddammit!
It's a little dip in the road or  something. You can see the reflectors  come up the other side.
(curses to himself) I knew this would happen. (grabs radio mike)
I'll see if there's anyone coming.  Maybe we can get pulled out.
Tom opens the door. Charlie adjusts the radio frequency  selection button; clicks on.
Dispatch, this is 31. 31 calling  dispatch.
(over radio) 31, this is dispatch.
(into radio) Dispatch, we're stuck outside of  Huntingburg. Truck's dead.
Where are you?
We're on 231, headed for the  Interstate. Right by a sign saying  "Welcome to Huntingburg."
Tom climbs out and up on top of the truck.
Tom stands on top of the truck. In one direction, nothing but blackness. The other way he can see the lights of the town. But there are no cars coming.
Charlie looks over as Tom appears, upside-down, in the  doorway.
The town's been evacuated. We won't  get any help from there.
Dispatch can't get anyone out.
They are aware we're carrying a  shitload of money...?
They called the National Guard.  They're gonna be here in about ninety  minutes.
Ninety minutes? Jesus.
(nods; into radio) Dispatch, we're gonna need help a  little sooner than --
There's a sudden sparking sound and the radio cuts out an interior lights and the headlights go out.
Oh, shit.
Looking out as the Sheriff's car rolls past on the water- covered street. A HAND lets go of a curtain and it swings across the window.
The Sheriff motions Wayne to stop the car, then he grabs radio mike and clicks it on as a megaphone.
(into mike) Henry, I saw you. Come on out.
No one comes out of the house.
Henry, I'm not leaving until you  come out.
A few moments pass and then...
Late 70s, step out onto their porch.
Jesus H. Christ, Henry, I told you  to stay away from the damn window.
Gets out of the car.
What are you still doing here?
We're just --
We're setting traps.
That's illegal, Doreen.
You gonna arrest us, Sheriff? Hell,  are you even sheriff anymore, Sheriff?  Didn't you lose an election? I sure  as hell know I didn't vote for you,  and neither did Henry.
Doreen...
You don't need to set traps.
That's what they said in '73. When  we got back, anything the bastards  didn't steal they broke, just for  the hell of it.
That's not happening this time.
Damn right it's not.
You can't stay, you know that.
We're going to my sister's.
Good.
Soon as we finish setting the traps.
The Sheriff wants to say something more, but he's not abo to argue with Doreen. He just nods and gets back into the car.
The Sheriff climbs back in. He and Wayne watch Henry and  Doreen go back into the house, Doreen still nagging at He
God'll understand if you have to  drown her in the basement, Henry.
The Sheriff sighs, nods to Wayne. Wayne puts the car in g
The water is creeping up the sloping hood of the truck.
We gotta get out of here.
What about the money?
The money's safe; we're not. Water  rose about a foot in the last twenty  minutes. The National Guard isn't  going to be here for another hour.  You do the math.
Tom shrugs -- Charlie's right. They're about to get out w light washes up on them. They look out to see...

head_text.subj: THE HEADLIGHTS OF A GMC SUBURBAN

text: Approaching on the other side of the dip, a quarter-mile  away.
Look at each other then get out of the truck.
Stops on the far side of the dip -- a hundred yards away. The headlights shine across the water. Doors open and MEN get out.
Come around the front of the truck. They can't see throug the glare of the Suburban's bright headlights.
Hello!
You okay? You stuck?
Yes!
We'll see if we can get you out!  We'll be right over!
Charlie looks at Tom, relieved.
Looks like we might just --
Headlights go on high beam.
Squint, blinded by the high beams.
Why'd they do that?
Probably so they can see better.
Or so we can't see at all.
Charlie looks at him -- what does he mean? Tom puts his h on his pistol.
Assembled by the Suburban are...
All holding guns. He speaks to them quietly.
This is my retirement fund, boys,  and if any one of you screws up, I  swear to God I'll kill you. Let's  go.
They start wading down into the dip in the road. Kenny ca a rifle.
Tom squints through the bright light.
Company dispatch and the National  Guard are the only ones who know  we're here.
Anyone with a scanner from Radio  Shack could've intercepted your call,  Charlie.
(realizes) Jesus.
(to Jim and men) Could you turn down your lights?!
We're bringing a rope!
Turn down your lights!
We'll be right there!
Tom starts to pull his gun.
is fired up on adrenalin. He has his rifle up and is aimi it.
Tom with his hand on his pistol, starting to pull it out.
Charlie sees Tom going for his gun. He moves close to Tom half in front of him, putting his hand on Tom's.
Take it easy, Tom.
Stiffens.
Squeezes the trigger of his rifle.
Jumps at the sound of the rifle crack.
Is knocked back.
Yanks out his gun and starts shooting back.
Duck down in the water.
Shooting blindly, looks over and sees...
A horrible look on his face, blood coming out of his neck He sinks into the water.
Shoots off another few quick rounds.
Drops into the water, bullets plugging in around him. Jus his hand and pistol are visible, shooting blindly back to Jim and his men. THE SUBURBAN Is hit by Tom's fire.
Runs out of bullets. A beat later we see Charlie start mo through the water -- Tom is pulling him.
STOP SHOOTING!
Doesn't hear Jim and keeps firing.
Aims his pistol at Kenny's head.
Stop.
Kenny stops.
Tom comes up in the water behind the truck, gasping, hold Charlie. Tom rests his gun on the truck bumper.
I'm sorry, Tom.
Charlie's gone.
Jim glares at Kenny, his eyes on fire.
He was going for his gun!
He wasn't gonna shoot, Kenny.  Goddamnit! (shakes head, calls  to Tom) We just want the money! Get away and  we won't have to kill you!
Shuts his eyes, thinking, scared.
Now!
Tom opens his eyes. He looks down at...
Floating in the water.
What the hell is he going to do?
Jim's men look at him. Jim motions them to wait some more
You got thirty seconds to get the  hell away!
Jim and the others wait, but there's no answer from Tom.
The clock's running! Go!
Still no response from Tom.
All they can see is the front of the truck, in the light the "Welcome" sign. They can't see the back.

Jim nods to his men. They head for the truck, down into t deeper water at the bottom of the dip in the road. All ha guns up and ready. Jim sends Mr. Mehlor and Ray out to circle around. They a move quietly. The only sound is the rain.
Gets to the truck and moves along its side, Kenny right b him. Jim gets to the back of the truck, nods for Kenny to cover him, then steps out behind the truck, gun up.
Tom is gone.
Is floating in the water, eyes of glass.
Step into the circle of light thrown by the "Welcome" sig
(eyes Charlie) Ah, Jesus. (to Kenny) Your dad'd be real proud of you,  Kenny.
He was going for his gun!
Mr. Mehlor, I believe we're gonna  need your science project.
Mr. Mehlor nods and digs into his pack. Ray looks down at Charlie in the water.
"I shall bring floodwaters upon the  earth to destroy all that lives under  the heavens and every creature that  has the breath of life in it shall  perish." Genesis 6:17.
Were you a preacher or something?
Ray laughs.
Ray did five years in the hole at  Joliet. The only thing you get to  read in the hole is the Bible.
(to Ray) You got religion?
Obviously.
Mr. Mehlor laughs as he pulls something out of his pack.  It's...
A half-stick of dynamite with a timer, mounted on a magne
When you hit the switch you've got  thirty seconds.
You teach your students how to make  things like that?
Mr. Mehlor puts the device on the back door.
You been to a high school recently,  Ray? My students taught me how to  make things like that. Ready?
Hold on.

Something's wrong. Jim touches the handle on the door. It moves. Uh-oh. He raises his pistol, grabs the door handle and pulls. The door swings open. We don't need to see wha he sees -- we can tell from the expression on his face.
Tom is running hard through the knee-deep water, pulling string of canvas money bags buckled together. The truck a "Welcome" sign are two hundred yards behind him. Tom hear an angry yell.
Kenny is the one yelling.
Shut up. Everyone.
They quiet. The patter of the rain is too loud -- they ca hear anything. Jim scans the horizon, but sees nothing.
Now why'd he have to go and do a  thing like that?
To stay alive. (off their looks) He thinks we'll kill him -- unless  he knows where the money is and we  don't.
There is another possibility. (off their looks) He's thinking of keeping it for  himself.
There's always that. Either way, we  got ourselves a sharp one.
What do we do?
Jim is looking at something in the distance.
Pretty soon the water'll be too deep  for him to run. But for us it'll be  just deep enough.
(unclear) Deep enough for what?
A glass window is smashed and water floods into the boat  showroom. Jim and his men stride in. Kenny ogles a  particularly nice cruiser. Jim stops at a smallish ski-bo
Here we go.
(re: cruiser) What about this monster?
(re: ski-boat) This is all we need.
Shit, Jim, we're stealing. Can't we  take anything we want?
The water isn't very deep yet. We  need something with a low draft. Mr.  Mehlor -- find us some gasoline.
Mr. Mehlor heads off.
Sees something else he likes. We don't see what it is.
Oh, Jim...?
The name WILLIAM PORTMAN is chiseled into a crypt. Tom ap from underwater, gasping for breath. He gets to his feet trudges off through the water.
Tom comes out through the gates of the cemetery, splashin through the knee-deep water. He's running when he hears,  from behind him, boat engines firing up. He turns to see.
Racing toward him over the water, a hundred and fifty yar back.
Sprints off.
Jim is steering the ski-boat. Mr. Mellor hunkers down bes him. We PULL BACK to see...
Flanking the ski-boat, piloted by Kenny and Ray.
Tom is running as fast as he can. He looks back, sees the ski-boat and jet-skis closing. They'll get him before he  gets to town. He suddenly veers off the road toward...
The sign out front reads: GO WARRIORS!
Tom runs around the side of the high school.
Ride up on the ski-boat and jet-skis and round the corner
No sign of Tom.
Cut your engines!
The engines are shut down. They all drift. Jim shines a  flashlight over onto...
There's a hole in a window large enough to climb through.
Tom wades through the classroom, pushing floating desks a Flashlight beams stab into the room. Tom hurries to the h
Jim turns to his men.
Let's get him out. But for Godsake,  whatever you do... (with a hard look at  Kenny) ...don't kill him. Not until we find  out where he hid that money.
Tom makes his way past banks of lockers, trying to get as far as he can from the probing flashlight beams.
Kenny drifts up to the front doors. He pulls on them. Loc
Mr. Mehlor?
Reaches into his pack.
Tom tries lockers, looking for a place to hide.
Kenny rides his jet-ski fast away from the front doors an the doors explode.
Tom ducks down as...
Shoots over him.
Ride the jet-skis into the flooded school.
Tom is swimming as hard as he can, out of breath. KENNY A
Ray goes off down a hall while Kenny idles in the lobby.
Surfaces, gasping.
Hears the gasp, turns, grinning.
Enemy sub off the port bow!
Gets to his feet runs as fast as he can down the hall. He rounds a corner and keeps going.
Guns his engine and takes off after Tom.
Runs another thirty feet, then trips on something and goe down.
Comes around the corner, grinning when he sees...
Halfway down the hall, standing frozen, caught in Kenny's light.
Guns it, racing forward down the hall toward Tom.
Full steam ahead!
Hits something underwater and stops.
Keeps going. He flies through the air, slams headfirst in a trophy case and drops into the water.
Stands up -- he was kneeling.
Low tide, sailor.
On the wall, angles down into the water. Underwater there are a couple of steps leading up to a change in level in hall -- that's what the jet-ski grounded on.
Ray motors down the hallway toward the corner.
Kenny?
Around the corner comes a jet-ski. Ray assumes it's Kenny
See him?
Then the jet-ski speeds up and shoots by him. Ray sees it
Wearing Kenny's hat and jacket.
Gives chase.
Ray races after Tom along the flooded hallways, taking th turns fast. Ray pulls a gun, starts shooting.
Tearing through the halls, flashlight lighting the way.  Bullets hit the walls, ceiling, water around him.
Comes around a corner, sees the open front doors ahead of him.
Come into view in the ski-boat, blocking the exit.
Turns hard and speeds down a side hall.
A wall of windows at the end. No way out. Trapped. Then..
Rises out of the water, blood running down his face, pist up.
Looks back.
Is on his tail.
Makes his choice and guns the jet-ski straight at Kenny.
Yee-hah!
Fires, misses and is knocked to the side as...
Hunches down on the jet-ski and crashes through the windo
Jim and Mr. Mehlor are moving right outside the windows j as Tom blasts out of the school and races off into the da
Tom moves fast over the water. He yanks off his clip-on t
Chase Tom's light, behind by fifty yards, heading out int farm fields. They get closer and closer and then watch as
Runs straight into a tree and explodes.
Race up to find the burning, flaming wreckage of the jet- ski. Ray circles on the other jet-ski. Kenny, still bleed from the head, is in the boat with Jim and Mr. Mehlor.
(laughing) Nice driving, buttwipe!
I'm glad you're enjoying this, Kenny,  but if he's dead, how do we find the  money?
Kenny reacts -- oh, right.
Oh, he's still alive.
We see what Jim sees.
Tom used his tie to wrap the throttle open.
Tom is hiding in the branches of a floating tree, watchin the distant lights of Jim and his men. The current carrie Tom away.
Jim scans the horizon; sees nothing.
Ray, I'm in need of a little  inspiration.
"With a raging flood he makes an end  of those who oppose him, and pursues  his enemies into darkness." From one  of the more obscure --
Sorry to interrupt Bible study and  all, but has no one but me noticed  how completely screwed we are? We  should be back in the motel room,  counting out the money. Instead --
Jim lashes out with a fist, hard and fast, hitting Kenny the chest, knocking him out of the ski-boat, into the wat Kenny comes up in the thigh-deep water, sputtering.

No one likes this particular turn of  events, Kenny, but we have a choice --  we can can either deal with it or we  can walk away. There's a lot of money  out there, so I choose to deal with  it. If you want to go, that's fine --  start swimming. You want to stay,  that's fine, too -- just stop your  damn whining.
Jim pushes the throttle forward and the ski-boat takes of leaving Ray on the jet-ski, with Kenny in the water.
What the hell's his problem? All the  money in the world ain't worth a  goddamn nickel if you get caught.  It's not like there won't be other  jobs.
You may have more of these in you,  Kenny, but Jim doesn't.
Ray pulls Kenny up onto the jet-ski and takes off after J
The water level is creeping up a five-foot-high wall of  sandbags.
Looking out over the top of the sandbag wall. A tree floa by on the water.
Suddenly appear on the top of the wall and...
Pulls himself into view. He climbs over the wall, exhaust
Gasoline-powered pumps are sucking up any rainwater. The  sandbags have kept the floodwater at bay.
He hurries up the back steps and goes into the church.
Tom walks through a small room lined with closed cupboard He goes through a door.

Tom comes out into the altar. He looks around, impressed. It's a beautiful church. Scaffolding goes up one wall -- church is being restored. Tom is startled by a sound from above. He grabs a heavy silver candlestick as a weapon an looks up to see...
Fluttering up in the rafters.
Takes a breath. Just as he relaxes, he hears a whooshing  sound from behind him and turns to see...
Being swung at his head. Thunk and...
Tom slowly regains consciousness, blinking his eyes. He  hears...
What are you doing here?
But the Sheriff isn't asking Tom, he's asking...
30, pretty, even in head-to-toe rain gear.
I was setting up pumps.
I sure as hell don't get what you  see in that church.
I wouldn't expect you to, Wayne.
What's that supposed to mean?
Karen, did you think the order was  for everyone but you to evacuate?
I was gonna go as soon as I filled  the pumps, but the next thing I know,  I've got a looter on my hands. Now,  maybe I'm crazy, but I was expecting  a little gratitude?
I think it's great what you did.
That's it, Phil. That'll finally get  you into her pants.
Shut up.
What if he'd had a gun, Karen? A lot  of these looters carry guns.
I'm not a looter.
Sits up on a cot, behind bars in the holding cell, woozy.
Jim and his men are searching the school for the money.
Jim, it could be anywhere. It might  not even be in the school.
Keep looking.
The rain sheets down hard. A lightning flash reveals...
The water is up to the horse's knees. The lightning passe and a second later thunder rolls.
The Sheriff, Phil, Wayne and Karen stand outside the cell Tom is inside, on the cot. He touches the cut on his fore
What were you doing at the church?
I told you -- he was looting it.

I just said I'm not a looter! (to Karen) You're the one who nailed me? (Karen nods) You got a better arm than my ex-wife.  What the hell did you hit me with --  a statue? I saw a flash of some guy  coming at me.
(mumbles, embarrassed) It was a crucifix. (to others) It was the only thing there!
Oh, great. Now I'm gonna have people  coming from around the world to see  the face of Jesus on my forehead.
Look, son, what were you doing in  the church?
Looking for a place to hide out.
From who -- Swamp Thing?
The bastards who killed my partner.
That stops the room.

We were driving an armored truck.  The truck got stuck out past the  high school. They must've picked up  our call to dispatch, 'cause they  knew where we were. Charlie and I  were just standing there and all  hell broke loose.
How much money did you have?
A little over three million.
They all exchange a look -- that's a lot of money.
The bank was afraid of looters. They  had us cleaning out their branches  up and down the river.
They stole three million dollars?
No, I don't think so.
They all look at the Sheriff. He looks at Tom.
You took the money, didn't you.
I hid it in the cemetery. Tied it to  a crypt for a guy named Portman.
What the hell'd you do that for?
I don't like to carry around that  much cash.
Jesus, Wayne, use your head. If he  hadn't hidden it, they woulda killed  him, too.
The Sheriff looks at Tom -- is that it? Tom nods.
You got any ID?
No, it was in my jacket and I --
Color me surprised.
The Sheriff thinks for a beat, then tosses some keys to P
Get out two rifles and a shotgun.
Phil nods and goes to it. The Sheriff opens a desk drawer pulls out an ankle holster.
You believe him?
Well, yes, Wayne, I do. And even if  I didn't, I'd say we sure as hell  had an obligation to check it out,  don't you think?
The Sheriff starts strapping on the ankle holster.
I'll go with you. I can show you  where --
No, I think you better stay put. But  that was --
Yeah, all we need is an armored car  guy helping us out.
The Sheriff thwacks Wayne in the ear.
Ow!
Wayne, what's the worst that's ever  happened to you? When old Mrs. Dugan  went after you with a knife? This  guy just got shot at! (dismisses Wayne; to  Tom) Smart move with the money.
Phil comes over with the guns.
(to Phil) Wayne and I'll check out the cemetery.  You escort Slugger... (nods at Karen) ...out of town. Get her to some high  ground, then come on back.
The Sheriff jams a small pistol into his ankle holster.
I have to fill the pumps --
(pulling her out) Not any more you don't.
The Sheriff straightens up, grabs a rifle from Phil and p Karen to the door. Wayne goes to Tom's cell door and pull it shut with a click.
Wayne...
He could still be lying!
The Sheriff rolls his eyes and gestures for Wayne to come along. He opens the door for Karen, Wayne and Phil to go  through.
Sheriff -- they killed my partner  without any warning.
And they're gonna regret that, I  guarantee you. They're gonna regret  coming anywhere near this town  tonight. And out he goes.
Water is halfway up the four-foot high wall of sandbags a the station. There are three outboard motorboats moored t the sandbags.
Phil, take Karen's boat.
The Sheriff and Wayne climb toward their boats.
You can do it, Phil. The men of  Huntingburg are counting on you.
Just bite me.
Wayne laughs as he and the Sheriff fire up their boat eng
Tom hears boat engines start up and move away. He lays ba down on the cot, listening to the rain.
Empty. Light comes out from under the door to the bathroo
Hank is on the can reading a copy of "American Survivalis magazine. An odd reaction comes over his face. He feels  something weird. He looks down.
Water is seeping in under the door.
Holy shit!
The bathroom door flies open and Hank waddles out, pants  around his feet. He shuffles fast to the control wheels a starts spinning them.
Two gates open fast, all the way, and water thunders out.
Hank pulls up his pants as he gets on the radio.
Sheriff! Sheriff!
The Sheriff and Wayne are motoring in their boats, zoomin through the trees, engine noise obliterating anything com in over the radio.
(on the radio) Sheriff, come in!
Phil steers Karen's small boat down Main Street, past the statue. The water is up to the rider's stirrups.
(pleading) Did you see the stained glass windows,  Phil? Did you see what a good job  they did? I can't let anything happen  to the church, not after all I've  put into it.
Karen, you know I'd do anything for  you, but the Sheriff told me to get  you out of town. I'm sorry. It's for  your own good.
Karen stands up.
What're you doing?
If you're not going to take me back  to the church, then I'll swim.
Karen moves to get out of the boat.
No. Hey, hold on.
Phil lets go of the throttle and stands, moving toward Ka
What am I saying?
Karen suddenly turns on Phil and pushes him out of the bo
This is my boat. You swim.
Karen guns the engine and shoots off down a side street.  Phil stands in the waist-deep water and watches her go,  flabbergasted.
Karen comes around a corner and drives her boat up to the church. The water is swirling quietly, still a good three feet below the top of the wall.
Close on the lighted "Welcome to Huntingburg" sign. There a rushing sound and a two-foot-high wall of water hits th sign. The lights explode in geysers of sparks and the wat rushes on.

The Sheriff and Wayne are racing through a grove of half- submerged trees. There's a rushing sound above the sound the engines. WHAM! and they're hit by the wall of water.  Wayne falls out of his boat and is lost in the swirling w
Jim and his men are motoring down an alleyway when...
Rushes down the alley.
The water hits him hard, knocking him off the jet-ski. He swept away by the water.

head_text.subj: A FENCE LACED WITH CONCERTINA WIRE

text: The surge water shoots through it. And suddenly there's..
Slammed up against the fence, pinned to it, water rushing over and around and by him. He yells as the wire cuts int him.
Karen is pouring gasoline into the pumps. She hears the rushing and looks up as the surge hits. Wat shoots over the top.
Tom hears the sound and opens his eyes -- what the hell i that?
The wall of water slams in hard, cascading over the sandb wall.

head_text.subj: TOM SITS UP, SWINGING HIS LEGS OVER THE SIDE OF THE COT.

text: There's two feet of water in the station.
The building is like a rock in a stream, with the water  rushing up high against one wall, roiling and swirling ar the sides.
Tom looks over, stunned, to see... THE DOOR As a fine stream spits in through the keyhole.
Are heaving as the water rises up against them.
Gets to his feet, woozy and goes to get out of the cell. remembers -- uh-oh: the cell door is locked.
Jim pulls Ray, coughing, choking, bleeding, into the ski- boat.
The water level inside is rising fast. It hits the wall  sockets and there's a spit of sparks, then all the desk l go dark. Light still comes from overhead fluorescent pane Tom sees...

head_text.subj: TWO KEYS ON A KEY RING

text: Laying on the Sheriff's wooden desk. They're four feet aw too far to reach.
Karen suddenly has a horrible thought and stops. She shak it off -- doesn't want to think about it -- and mutters t herself.
They'll get him out.
Phil is clinging to the statue as the water surges by bel him.
Wayne gets back into his boat. The Sheriff realizes somet
Wayne... You locked him in.
Tom looks through the cell bars at wooden chairs bobbing the water. The Sheriff's desk lifts up, starts floating. gets an idea. He takes his belt off.
A telephone pole is half-submerged, being pulled along fa by the current.
Tom holds one end of the belt and tosses the rest of it a
Bobbing in the rising water. He misses the keys.

Tom tries again. The belt lands on the desk top. Tom very gently starts pulling. Too hard; the belt starts slipping off the desk. He gets it just right and the desk starts moving toward Tom. He reaches out with his hand,  stretching.
Touch the top of the desk, start pulling it toward him, a he just gets a firm grip on the desk when...
Smashes into a window, bending in the bars on the window, shattering the glass, letting a torrent of water into the room.
Is moved by the rush of water, but not before Tom grabs..
And grips them tight.
Tries the keys in the lock. They don't fit. He looks at t
The tag is emblazoned with the Ford logo.
Great! I can drive out of here!
Tom tosses the keys into the water and looks around at...
Rising very fast. A foot in ten seconds.
Climbs up the cell bars, the water rising with him. He's  running out of room between himself and the ceiling. Thre feet. Two feet. He's being pushed up by the water toward.
On the ceiling, caged in a wire cover.
Is terrified, about to die. The water rises up past his f
Pull his Maglite flashlight from his belt. He takes off t lens and the battery cap, then shakes the batteries out.
Sticks the flashlight tube up through the wire grate over the light fixture. He blows out the water -- like clearing a snorkel -- then breathes. Reprieve for a few moments and then...
Reaches the top of the flashlight tube and starts to tric in when...
Goes dark. In the darkness, there's the sound of tubes  breaking and metal being wrenched.
Looks up, astonished, to see...
Being lifted up and away from above. Streetlight comes in silhouetting...
Standing on the roof. The figure leans down and starts tu at the wire cage over the inside of the fixture. In the l Tom sees that it's...

And she's pulling as hard as she can, but the wire cage i budging. She pulls out a Swiss Army knife, unfolds a smal knife and starts taking out the screws holding the cage i place. She gets two screws out.
Pulls on the cage and it swings down. He climbs up it.

Tom surfaces in a hole in the roof. There's a vent duct l on the roof -- Karen must've kicked that over to get to t light fixture. Karen helps Tom up. She sits and he lays d on the roof, catching his breath.
Thank you.
I owed you -- for hitting you and  all. But we're even now, okay?
Even. (beat, looks around) What happened?
I don't know.
They get up.
Maybe another levee broke upriver.  They've been --
Just then...
Explodes. The fireball rips across the dark sky, illumina everything, showing...
Fifty feet away -- Jim, Mr. Mehlor and Ray in the ski-boa and Kenny on the jet-ski -- guns aimed at Tom and Karen.
Oh, God.
As the lightning passes, and in the darkness, the thunder rolls.
Switch on their lights and move forward. They pass...
Floating down the street with other debris. The cars have been damaged by the flood -- one is missing a door.
When they get closer to the Sheriff's station, what they or don't see -- makes them stop.
Tom and Karen have disappeared. Karen's boat is still moo to the Sheriff's station roof, empty.
They're in the water! Kenny, cut  your engine!
Kenny shuts off the engine of the one remaining jet-ski. shuts down the boat engine. They float in silence, scanni the water with their flashlights. There's no sign of Tom Karen.
Tom motions Karen to follow him. She's freaked and hesita Tom grabs her hand and pulls her.
The ski-boat and jet-ski are right above them, flashlight playing over the water.
Reach the roof of the Sheriff's station. Jim looks around
Kenny, go that way. We'll go down  here.
Of Kenny and Jim heading off in different directions.
Rise into view in a car. They gasp for air and keep low.
Tell them where the money is.
I can't.
Well, I can.
She's about to call out. Tom grabs her hard.
If they know where the money is,  they will kill us.
Before Karen can say anything, a flashlight beam comes  swinging toward them and they have to duck underwater.
Watches as his flashlight beam washes over the car. Nothi there. He guns his engine and heads off down the street.
Floats off around a corner.
Tom and Karen surface, catch their breath. Quiet for a fe moments as they both look around to see that Jim and his are gone.
So what do we do?
I guess just drive around until we  run out of gas.
(pissed) Look, I've spent the last eight months  of my life restoring that church,  and I just left it to come save your  ass, so spare me, okay?

(beat) When we get down here a little further  we'll find a place for you to hide. (off her look) I'm gonna get back to the truck and  wait for the National Guard. (checks watch) They should be there pretty soon.
Karen nods. Tom looks at her. She's shivering.
Cold?
No, I'm fine. The heater just kicked  in.
Tom looks at her, gives a little grin. Their eyes meet fo second, then they look away.
Phil climbs up onto the roof, exhausted. He sees the hole the roof and goes to look at it. As he's looking down...
Is he dead?
Phil turns to see...
Coasting up in their boats.
No. Someone got him out.
Who?
(hesitates) Maybe Karen.
Karen? How could she get him out?  You took her out of town.
I -- It --
Let's hear it, Phil.
It happened real fast, okay?
Tom and Karen float down the alley in the car.
You ever been robbed before?
No. The scariest thing that ever  happened before was Charlie running  out of donuts. (off her look) I've only been doing this for a couple  months.
(not what she wanted  to hear) Oh.
Silence for a few moments.
What'd you do before this?
I, uh... I sold construction  machinery. (off her look) I was making good money, it just...  I don't know. It just didn't seem  right for me anymore.
How'd you end up in this?
My uncle did me a favor; got me in.
Nice favor. How's he gonna feel after  tonight?
My uncle was Charlie -- my partner  in the truck.
Oh, God. I'm sorry.
Tom nods -- so is he.
Phil climbs into the Sheriff's boat.
She know karate or something, Phil?  Maybe kung fu? I mean, I can't see  how else she could overpower the  likes of you.
Shut up, Wayne.
Shut up, both of you. Let's go find  Karen; see if she's got him.
The Sheriff fires up his engine and heads off, Wayne  following.
Karen and Tom are still in the car. They freeze at the so of engines in the distance. The sounds fade. Tom looks ar
God, I wonder whose car this is.
Karen plucks some cassette tapes out of the water.
Well, whoever it is, he listens to  Pat Benatar, Eddie Money and the  soundtrack to "Footloose."
Really? (looks at tapes) Hold on... (looks around car) ...I think this is my car from high  school.
Karen laughs. Just then...
Gets caught on something and stops.
Looks like we get out here. (Karen hesitates) Come on -- I told your father I'd  have you home by ten.
Karen grins. Just then...
down the street explodes.
Hear a sparking sound and look over to see...

On a telephone/power pole close to them. Rain hits it, ca the sparking sound. The floodwater is inching up the pole toward it. The water will reach the transformer in a matter of secon And while they're staring at that...
At the end of the street explodes as water hits it.
Look around -- what to do? Tom points.
There!
They climb out of the car and start swimming toward a hou
Water is three inches from the transformer; two inches...
Swimming as hard as they can.
One inch from the water...
Reach the house. They pull themselves up onto a televisio antenna/ladder running up the side of the house. Karen's  feet are still in the water.
Get your feet up!
The water is about to touch. There's a sizzling sound.
They heave a huge sigh of relief -- but then Tom realizes
Oh, shit!
What?
(re: antenna/ladder) It's metal!
Tom pushes Karen over onto a window ledge. Then, just as  Tom's about to step over...
Comes screaming in on the jet-ski. He dives off the jetsk gets a hold of Tom and pulls him under.
Surface. Kenny is stronger and he has Tom in a tight grip One problem -- Kenny doesn't know the danger they're in.
We've gotta --!
Kenny shoves Tom underwater.
HEY! I GOT HIM!
Tom comes up, looks over at...
The sizzling is getting louder.
We have to --!
Kenny dunks Tom again.
I GOT HIM!
Tom grabs Kenny's arms and pulls himself up fast.
Tom's head comes out of the water and slams into Kenny's  chin. Kenny is stunned. Tom gets free of his grasp.
Hurry!
Tom does the backstroke, pulling hard toward Karen.
Still stunned, finally hears the sizzling and looks over  at...
The water touches the outer casing of the transformer.
Starts swimming fast toward...
Karen grabs Tom's arm and Tom gets a hold of the windowsi and pulls himself up.
Grabs onto...
And starts pulling himself out of the water.
Explodes.
Feels pretty pleased with himself until...
Starts dancing with electricity and...
Is hit by the voltage and his teeth clamp shut and his bo goes rigid and his clothes explode in flames.
Look away.
Dead fish start floating to the surface.
Is fried, smoking. He falls off the TV antenna and hits t water with a loud and ugly hiss. He floats away, his body shaking spasmodically.
Tom hears an engine approaching. He looks around, then sm the window with his elbow.
The window glass tumbles in. Tom reaches in, undoes the l and slides up the window. He climbs in, straddling the wi sill. The camera moves down Tom's leg to show...
Laying on the floor, just below the window.
Is oblivious. He starts to put his foot down into the tra Just then he knocks...
Off the windowsill. It falls straight down into...
Hitting the trigger. The jaws snap, obliterating the cact
Jesus Christ!
Snaps into view, pointing right at Tom's head.
You so much as breathe funny and  your head is going back out that  window without you.
Jim drives the boat down the street. Mr. Mehlor is scanni the water with a flashlight.
Jim! Over there!
Jim looks over to see...
Floating in the water. And not far from it is...
Still twitching.
Sequence omitted from original script.
Doreen holds the shotgun on Tom and Karen as they move aw from the window, hands raised.
Real slow now. Like you were in a  big jar of molasses. That's it.
They hear footsteps coming down old wood stairs.
Doreen? You haven't killed anybody,  have you?
I've got everything under control,  Henry. You go back up.
Henry enters.
Jesus, Doreen, you caught a whole  gang.
Jim and Mr. Mehlor pull Kenny into the ski-boat. Kenny is shivering. Part of his hair has been burned away.
Jesus, God, it hurts!
You're gonna be okay, Ken. Mr. Mehlor  knows these things and he thinks  you're gonna be okay.
Mr. Mehlor looks at Jim. Mr. Mehlor knows these things an he thinks Kenny is going to die.
It hurts!
Don't you, Mr. Mehlor? Don't you  think Kenny's gonna be okay?
Yeah, Kenny. You're gonna be fine.
Jesus, I can't stop shivering.
Mr. Mehlor moves aside. Jim puts his arms around Kenny.
I know you didn't want me to come.
You kidding? We couldn't've done  anything without you.
My dad'd sure be pissed off, huh?
Your dad'd just want you to lay still  while we got you some help.
Hey -- hey the pain's goin'. (relief) Oh, man.
He looks up at Jim and grins.
When you said I was gonna be okay, I  thought you were just shittin' me.
See? You gotta trust me.
Kenny's shivering stops. It stops because he's dead. Jim  slowly lets go.
Henry and Doreen have brought everything into their attic a TV, some silver and china, bowling trophies. A Coleman  lantern lights the room.
(sarcastic) Well, isn't that just wonderful! Now  these bastards are gonna want to  kill us, too! Why the hell did you  have to come to this house?
We thought it was empty.
You know what? The house next door  is empty. So whaddya say we go back  downstairs and you two keep moving?
We are not going to send these people  out to the wolves.
Oh, we're not, are we? Then what's  your plan, General Schwartzkopf?
I -- I just don't think --
It's okay. I have to go anyway.
They look at him, surprised.
The National Guard'll be at the truck  in about fifteen minutes. I'm gonna  go wait for them.
You can't swim that far in fifteen  minutes.
He could take our boat.
Henry!
(to Tom) I'll go get it ready for you.
Henry, he is not taking our boat.
Henry ignores Doreen. He pushes the attic stairs down, he down them.
(grabs TV; to Tom) Here. You want a TV too? How about  some china? Maybe our silver? (sets TV down) Henry! Henry, you leave the boat  where it is!
Doreen heads off down the stairs. Tom starts down the sta stops.
Karen? (she looks at him) I'm Tom.
They shake hands.
Watch yourself, Tom. I really don't  wanna have to save your life again.
Tom nods and goes down the stairs.
Henry stands on the roof of the back porch, steadying a s rowboat as Tom gets in. Doreen nags from the window.
You give away our only boat in the  middle of a flood. You are a genius,  Henry. A goddamn genius.
(whispers to Henry,  re: Doreen) You wanna come with me?
Henry looks at Tom, entertaining the notion...
Jesus, Henry, what are you waiting  for -- a kiss goodbye? Get back in  here.
Henry sighs and lets go of the boat. Tom rows off.
We see him in silhouette, crossing the gap between two ho
Are watching, from the shadows on the dark side of the st
Why don't we just get him?

If our resourceful young friend hears  us coming, he'll electrocute us or  sink us or one of you'll shoot him.  Besides... (glances at watch) ...I know where he's going. What I'd  like to know is where he came from.

The Sheriff sits in his boat, moored to the wall of sandb around the church. Wayne's boat is tied up next to it. Th floodwater is trickling over the top of the wall. The gas powered pumps inside the wall are keeping the waters at b
Come out of the front doors of the church.
They're not here.

Tom rows up to the truck and "Welcome" sign. His flashlig shows just the top of the truck and sign. Tom looks at hi watch, ties the rowboat to the sign, jumps into the water A few moments pass, then Tom surfaces, holding a shotgun. Then he senses something behind him and turns to see...
Floating in the water, tongue out, eyes glassy.
Kicks away, horrified. And then he hears an engine. He lo
Jim's ski-boat is coming over the water. The engine cuts and the ski-boat drifts, a hundred feet from Tom.
(yelling) Son, before you go underwater and do  something tricky, there's something  I'd like you to see!
A flashlight comes on, the beam swivels, illuminating...
Standing in the ski-boat, blinking in the light.
Slumps.
Now, I know it's your job to protect  that money, and maybe you'd even be  foolish enough to give your life for  it. The question is, are you willing  to give their lives for it?
Jim puts a pistol to Doreen's head.
Drop the gun and get into the boat.
Thinks for a second, then throws the shotgun away and pul himself into the rowboat.
Excellent choice.
As Tom and Jim call to each other across the water, Doree goes at Henry.
I'll take you to the money, but you  gotta let them go.
I hope you're proud of yourself,  Henry Sears.
Shh.
I think it'd be best if --
I told you not to give him the goddamn  boat.
Doreen, please.
I think it'd be best if we all stayed  together.
You say all you want is the money?  Prove it. Let them go.
I don't know if that's --
We could be safe in our home instead  of out here in a boat with these low- life scumbags!
(after a look at  Doreen, nods to Mr.  Mehlor) Let 'em go.
The Sheriff, Wayne and Phil motor past the statue. Wayne driving his boat; Phil is with the Sheriff. The water is to the General's neck.
Tom helps Henry and Doreen over into the rowboat. As he d his face comes close to Henry's for a second.
(whisper) Karen?
(shakes head, whispers) In the attic. They never saw her.
Karen swims down the center of the street.
Tom is in the ski-boat with Jim. He looks out at...
As Henry rows them off into the darkness.
(disappearing in dark) Faster, Henry! The bastards might  change their minds! Stop lily- dipping  and move it!
Henry starts to turn the boat around.
What're you doing?
I'm gonna row back there and see if  he'll shoot you. Or me. Fine either  way.
Henry...?
Do you want me to get us out of here?
Yes, of course, I --
Then shut the fuck up.
Henry turns the boat around and rows off. Doreen is silen
Jim shakes his head. Tom looks at Ray, coughing and at Ke dead. Tom doesn't know what to say.
The only thing I want to hear from  you is where the money is.
The Sheriff and Wayne are motoring fast down a street, th Sheriff leading. The Sheriff sees something in the water front of him. He curses and throttles down fast.
Is in the water, exhausted and cold.
Jim pilots the ski-boat into the cemetery. All are aghast
Are floating in the water. Half of them have drifted up  against the fence; the others are headed that way.
I wonder where they think they're  going.
What the hell's going on?
This happened in a flood in Georgia.  The ground gets soggy, and the caskets  are air-tight -- anyone who hasn't  been planted too long just pops up.
You teach your students stuff like  that? No wonder they kicked you out.
I didn't teach my students anything  at all.
(to Tom) Where is it?
It's hard to tell now with the water  so deep.
Jim cocks the hammer on his pistol. Tom gets the hint.
It's down there a little further.
Jim nods, gives the engine some juice and they move on.
Takes a quick look at his watch.
Sees Tom looking at his watch.
Karen is in the Sheriff's boat, wearing Phil's jacket, tr to warm up.
Tom went off in their rowboat.
(to Phil) It's Tom now. Looks like you lost  out, pal.
Where was he going?
Back to the armored truck.
Jim throttles down the ski-boat engine.
Here?
Uh... no. A little farther --
They're not coming, son.
Tom looks over at Jim, pretending to be confused.
What?
The National Guard. They're not  coming.
I don't --
I know you've been trying to stall  until they show up, but they're not  coming.
(pause as he realizes) Oh, God. You intercepted Charlie's  call, then you called them off.
No, son, I didn't call them off.  They never were coming. We didn't  "intercept" Charlie's call. He called  us direct.
And on Tom's look of disbelief...
Hank is on the radio.
I'd love to help you, Sheriff, but I  can't leave! If the water goes over  the top again it's bye-bye, dam! Bye- bye, town! In fact, I could use a  little help up here myself.
The Sheriff is in his boat; Wayne is back in his own. The Sheriff is on the radio.
Hank, remember when Mike Crane holed  up in Jack Finch's barn and said he  was gonna burn it down?
Hey, I was the one who got the dumb  son-of-a-bitch to come out.

Right. And before you went in, I  deputized you, you dumb son-of-a- bitch! So when I say get down here,  it's not a request, it's an order.  So get down here! Now! I won't need  you for long. And bring your gun.
We were gonna hit you just before  you got on the Interstate, but then  you got stuck so we had to change  our plans and take you --
Bullshit. This is all bullshit.

I knew Charlie when we were both  working construction for the Johnstown  company. His middle name was McCarthy  because his parents loved Charlie  McCarthy on the radio. His wife's  name was Mary. She died of a heart- attack last year. He has a daughter  and a son, both grown with children  of their own. I'm afraid I don't  know the names of the grandchildren.
Tom looks down, not wanting to believe.
What else do I know...? Oh, yes. I  know Uncle Charlie was trying to  steer his favorite nephew away from  a life of crime.
Tom suddenly lunges for Jim. Ray yanks Tom back.
Why'd you shoot him? Kill Charlie  and you get to keep another share?

No, That was an accident. Ken shot  him. (eyes Kenny sadly) I never told him Charlie was on my  side. Ken liked to talk. (shakes head) He shouldn't've been here. But his  dad asked me to watch over him. I  guess I didn't do the best job.
Excuse me, Jim. I hate to interrupt  and all, but could we just get the  money and get the hell out of here?

(nods; to Tom) I'm gonna ask you one more time. And  before you think of bullshitting me  again, keep in mind I have had a  very frustrating night. And while I  know I'll never get the money if I  kill you, it's getting to the point  where I just don't care.
Jim casually aims his gun at Tom.
I'll tell you where it is. But it's  not going to do you any good.
Jim arches an eyebrow.
The Guard may not be coming, but  someone else sure as hell is.
At the controls of his boat, moving fast, sprayed by rain Karen and Phil are in the back of the boat. Wayne is clos behind in his boat.
I'll take my chances.
Tom pauses, looks over to...
Just the top of it is visible. Two more COFFINS float nea
There.
Jim steers the ski-boat over, hands Tom a flashlight.
Well, go get it.
Tom climbs over the edge of the ski-boat and into the wat He turns on the flashlight and drops below the surface.
(eyeing Tom in water) "At night we'd go down to the river  and into the river we'd dive." (off Jim and Mehlor's  looks) Springsteen, "The River." I'm all  out of bible quotes.
Tom shines his light on...
One end of a rope is tied to the crypt. The other end, cu and frayed, is suspended in the water, waving in the curr
Jim watches Tom's light rise. Tom comes up fast, takes a  breath.
It's gone.
What?
(smug) Looks like somebody beat you to it.
Oh for Christs -- I'm gonna shoot  him, Jim.
Ray grabs pistol in his belt. Before he can pull it out,  holes puff out of his chest, followed by blood and then t sound of the rifle-shots. Ray tumbles into the water. A h second later there's...
Ripping into the ski-boat, water, trees, crypt.
Are outside the fence, a hundred feet from the crypt. PUS IN FAST on...
To the rescue. He and Wayne and Phil fire their guns.
Ducks underwater.
Pulls his pistol, returns fire.
Opens fire with a shotgun, shooting wild, yelling. Then h hit and knocked out of the boat, dead.
Stop! You'll hit Tom!
The Sheriff stops shooting, yells at the others.
Hold your fire!
Wayne and Phil stop shooting.
Tom is holding onto a coffin, out of view of the Sheriff. hears a rush of bubbles and turns as...
Comes to the surface, breathing deep.
Comes out of the water fast and the barrel goes to Tom's  forehead.
There's an adrenal fire in the Sheriff's eyes. He starts boat forward, Wayne following. Their lights find...
No sign of life. Then there's a sound and the lights swee over to find...
Climbing up on top of the mostly-submerged crypt. Jim is  behind Tom with his gun to Tom's head.
Stops his boat. Wayne stops, too. They are thirty yards f Jim and Tom.
A look passes between them.
(to Sheriff) Now, sir, I can imagine you'd love  nothing more than to shoot me, but I  caution you -- in order to do that,  you're gonna have to shoot through  young Tom here.
Thinks for a second, then shrugs.
Okay.
He raises his rifle.
Realizes what is about to happen.
Also clue in, but before they can move...
Squeezes the trigger as...
Hits the gun with her arm.
Fires.
is grazed in the arm by the bullet.
Smacks Karen hard with his rifle and she tumbles out of t boat, unconscious.
Throw themselves back off the crypt as...
Empty their guns in their direction.
Returns fire, shooting blindly over the top of the crypt.
Reaches for Karen, floating limp in the water, but...
Is closer. He grabs Karen and pulls her into his boat, th grins at Phil.
Are behind the crypt. Tom holds his bleeding arm. Jim rel
Well, that was unexpected.
Is he the one you thought was coming  to your rescue?
No answer from Tom, but the answer is clear.

head_text.subj: WITH THE SHERIFF AND HIS MEN

text: The Sheriff and Wayne reload.
Anyone mind telling me what the hell  is going on?
The Sheriff, Wayne and Phil turn to see...
In his boat, right behind them, all dressed up in hunting gear, rifle at the ready.
Hey, Hank. That money I told you  about? From the armored car? We're  gonna keep it. Three million dollars.  Four ways. (shoots at crypt) Seven fifty apiece. You okay with  that?
Hank is stunned. He doesn't answer.
Hank? You okay with that?
Seven hundred and fifty thousand  dollars? (beat, grins) Damn straight I'm okay with that.
(grumbling, re: Hank) Don't see what we needed him for.
Then I guess you've never been hunting  with Hank. (to Hank) We got two behind that crypt. Get  'em.

Hank nods. He motions for Wayne to go one way; he'll go t other. They start off. A blind shot comes from Jim behind the crypt. The Sheriff shoots back. Phil finally musters the courage to say something.
Maybe I'm not okay with it.
Come on now, Phil.
You're gonna kill people?
They're looters, Phil! They come and  steal from an armored truck in our  town -- they're looters. (fires two shots)
What about Tom? What about Karen?  They're not looters.
No, they're witnesses.
The Sheriff fires off a flurry of bullets.
Behind the crypt, bullets winging by. Jim looks over, see
Motor into view.
Opens fire.
Shoots back.
Flattens against the crypt, then turns to see...
Coming into view on the other side.
Looks at Jim, sees he's occupied in the fight with Hank.  Then he sees...
Floating in the water, dead, pistol still jammed in his p
Thinks, decides, and reaches out for Ray.
Shooting at Hank. He hears gunfire from Wayne and is abou to swivel to shoot in that direction when he hears a gun  firing from right next to him. He turns to see...
Shooting back at Wayne with Ray's gun.
Pulls back out of the line of fire.
Curses and pulls back, too.
Exchange a look.
How can you do this?
Jeez, Phil, I always thought Wayne  was the stupid one. Read my lips. (slowly) Three million dollars. Look at it!
The Sheriff reaches down into a forward storage area of t boat and pulls back a tarp revealing the bags of money.
A couple of those bags are gonna be  yours, Phil.
But -- but -- you're the Sheriff!
The Sheriff rips his badge off and throws it away.
I'm the what?
Jim looks at Tom, then hands Tom his pistol. Tom doesn't  know what Jim's doing. Jim slips beneath the water.
Whistles and gets Wayne's attention. He motions Wayne to it again.
For twenty years you've been --
For twenty years I've been eating  shit, breakfast, lunch and dinner.  Well, tonight I'm changing the menu!  From now on everything I eat is gonna  be shit-free!
Tom is looking for Jim, to see what he's doing. And then.
Come around on both sides.
Starts shooting at them with the two pistols.
Pull back. As they go...
Sees...
Draped over the side of Wayne's boat.
Takes another shot at Hank but stops firing at Wayne.
Jim's hand appears over the gunwale. He reaches in and  grabs...
And pulls it out of the boat.
Can I make it any clearer, Phil? Do  you want me to draw pictures?
Phil pulls out his revolver and points it at the Sheriff.
I can't let you do it.

Oh for -- (beat) Okay, Phil. But here's how it's gonna  go. I'm gonna hear one of two things  out of you. Either I'm gonna hear  you say you're in with us, or... (moves close to Phil's  gun) ...I'm gonna hear a bullet come out  of that gun and go into me.
Phil is incredulous. The Sheriff weighs his hands like sc
(one hand) Seven hundred and fifty thousand  dollars or... (other hand) ...you kill me. Your choice.
The Sheriff weighs the hands a couple more times. Phil sl lowers the gun.
There we go.
Flies through the air; lands in the water by the Sheriff. It's...
And it starts sinking in the water.
Tom sees...
Haul himself into the ski-boat.
In the boat!
Start shooting at Jim in the ski-boat.
Sticks the shotgun over the gunwale and returns fire.
Starts swimming for the boat.
See Tom and start shooting at both he and Jim when...
Explodes and...
Erupts in a huge geyser.

Fires up his engine.
Is almost to the boat.
Gets to his knees in his boat and starts shooting.
Gets to Jim's boat and grabs onto it.
Cranks the throttle, and, dragging Tom, tears off under t hail of Wayne's bullets.

Rams into one cross.
Start to slip from the boat.
Grabs Tom's hand and holds on as they shoot off across th water.
Get back in the boats.

(beat, looks up at  Jim) You really want that money?
Jim gives Tom a look -- of course he wants that money.
'Cause the only way you're ever gonna  see it is if you help me get Karen.

Coming after them in the three boats, shooting, closing.
We're too slow.
(thinks, then:) Here.
Jim moves away from the wheel, giving it to Tom. Tom gets and takes over. Jim bends and picks up...
Lifeless and limp.
Looks at Kenny for a moment, then pushes his body overboa

text: Flying over the water.

Is laying on the deck, unconscious. Just then... BAM! BAM
Has his rifle resting on his boat's windshield and is fir off a clip on automatic as he, Wayne and the Sheriff clos in.

Keeps up his stream of gunfire.
Stays down, driving blind, as the bullets fly in, blowing holes in the windshield. He looks at Jim, at the engine a curses. He steers the boat toward...
All lit-up, brilliant white in the darkness, a quarter-mi away.

Comes up fast. Tom grounds it on top of the sandbag wall. Tom hesitates for a half second before grabbing Jim and  pushing him out of the boat and into the water.
Hits the cold water and comes to, sputtering.
Grabs guns and ammo and jumps out of the boat and into th water. He lays a rifle on the top of the sandbag wall and fires off a clip.
Jim's bullets plug into their boats. They circle back.
Tom pushes Jim, still groggy, into the flooded church.
Tom shuts the door. He piles the weapons on a shelf. He s Jim touch his head.
That hurt?
Yeah.
Good.
Wayne and Hank are alongside the Sheriff, engines idling they look at the church.
(nods, to Hank) Then go get some bottles.
Hank nods, guns his engine.
(to Hank) Wait -- what about the dam?
It'll be fine.
You said if it goes it'll wipe out  the town.
Fuck the town.
Hank nods in agreement and takes off.
Jim and Tom are by one of the stained glass windows, look out through a pale-colored pane at the Sheriff and his me across the street. They watch Hank race off.
Does he have the girl?
(shakes head) She's in the small boat.
Tom touches the wound on his head.
Jesus, I'm gonna get hepatitis.
Hepatitis, hell. You probably already  got cholera.
Tom gives Jim a look then starts for the back of the chur
What're you doing?
There's a back room. (touches wound) Maybe they've got something I can  use on this.
You been in here before?
(bad memory) Oh, yeah.
What happened?
I saw Jesus.
Water is starting to go over the top again. It pours down sheets over the face of the dam.
Jim is by the window, looking out at the Sheriff and Wayn across the street in the shadows. He turns as...
Enters from the back. He's got a bottle of rubbing alcoho and a towel. He splashes some of the alcohol on the towel then touches it to his wound. It hurts like a sonofabitch After a beat...
So, has this all gone pretty much  how you thought it would?
Jim turns on Tom.
Everything would have gone fine if  you'd've just walked away from the  truck.
Oh, yeah? Well, everything would've  gone even better if you hadn't decided  to rob the damn truck in the first  place!
Jim looks away. After another silence...
Did Charlie have cancer or something?
You mean why was he doing this? (thinks, shrugs) No cancer. (beat) Didn't you ever think about taking  the money?
No.
Come now. A man who used to make his  living fencing hot jackhammers never  thought about what he'd do with three  million dollars?
Sorry to disappoint you. (beat) What are you gonna do with it?
As little as possible.
Silence for a few moments, then...
Belize.
Jim looks at him.
It's this small country in Central  America, on the Atlantic side.
I know where Belize is. What about  it?
They speak English and the dollar  goes a long way. Beautiful beaches;  friendly people. And they've got  liberal banking laws. Very liberal.
No, you didn't think about taking  that money at all.
(busted) You can't ride in the truck and not  think about it.
I'm sure. And I guess that's pretty  much how it started with Charlie.
Tom thinks, nods and presses the towel to his wound again
Wayne is thinking about something. He makes a decision an flicks on his engine.
What're you doing?
We got too many bodies with bullets  in 'em. (nods at Karen) I'm gonna put her in her house, make  it look like she fell down the stairs  and drowned.
Don't you touch her!
Saving her life... Hmm... You know,  that might have actually gotten you  laid.
Oh, for Christsakes, just dump her  here.
We got a few minutes before Hank  gets back.
Just dump her here!
Wayne ignores the Sheriff and motors off.
Wayne! Goddamnit, we've gotta get  them outta there! Wayne!
But Wayne keeps going.
Tom watches Wayne drive off with Karen.
Shit. Where's he going?
Tom grabs a rifle, frustrated and angry.
Hank motors up to the Sheriff and Phil.
Where's Wayne going?
On a date. You all set?
Yeah, but --
Then let's go.
Aren't we gonna wait for Wayne?
We can get started without him, the  dumb shit. He won't be long. Besides,  we got Phil. Phil's gonna earn his  money on this, aren't you Phil?
Phil looks scared shitless.
Water continues to pour over the top. CLOSE ON CONCRETE Chunks of cement are starting to wash away.
Tom finishes reloading a gun.
What -- you're gonna swim after her?
Tom doesn't answer. He moves toward the front door. Jim c him off.
You ain't gonna help her by getting  shot. He's gone and you don't know  where.
The Sheriff knows. I think maybe  I'll go ask him.
You'll be dead before you get over  the sandbags. (beat) Look, he'll be coming for us. You  can ask him then.
Jim sees something out the window.
What if he doesn't come?
I wouldn't worry about that.
Tom sees what Jim sees.
The Sheriff, Phil and Hank are heading toward the church, flaming Molotov cocktails in their hands.
The Sheriff, Phil and Hank heave the flaming Molotov  cocktails.
The bottles hit, explode. Sheets of fire rain down the ro
Smashes through a window.
Tom and Jim duck down as...
Flies across the inside of the church and smashes against wall, sending sheets of fire down the wall.
The roof is on fire.
Modest, two-story, on a side street. The front door is op the boat tied up outside. There's a light on in the front hall.

Karen is unconscious. Wayne has her laying on the stairs  leading up from the entry area to the second floor. There three feet of water in the house. Karen's legs are in the water. Her hands are handcuffed to a railing attached to wall, running up the stairs. Wayne stands over Karen, pat her face.
Wakey-wakey.
Karen stirs, then starts slipping back into unconsciousne so Wayne splashes her face with water. Karen comes to,  sputtering. Her eyes focus. She looks up at Wayne. Wayne  grins.

Dear Penthouse: I always thought  your letters were fake, until the  wildest thing happened to me. I'm a  policeman in a small town. In the  middle of the big flood last year, I  was patrolling the streets in a boat,  feeling kind of sorry for myself --  'cause it was my birthday and all --  when I saw the front door to a house  was open. I pulled my gun -- afraid  it might be looters. Imagine my  surprise when, instead of a looter,  I find a young woman handcuffed to  the railing of her stairs. Her name  was Karen, and ever since she came  back from college she'd made it clear  she was too good for any of us local  folk. Now here she was, in handcuffs!  I said, "What the heck is going on  here, ma'am?" And she said...
Karen says nothing. Wayne leans in close.
And she said...
Sorry, Wayne, but I'm not playing a  part in your sick little play.
Wayne pulls his gun, puts it to Karen's head.
You're perfect for the role. I suggest  you reconsider.
Or what? You'll kill me? You're gonna  do that anyway.
I might get clumsy. It might take a  while.
I'm sure you can hurt me. But it's  all going to be the same when I'm  dead.
Wayne straightens up, looks at her, then launches back in it.
And she said, "Happy Birthday, Wayne.  I've got something for you." Well,  I'm not stupid. I knew what she wanted  to give me and I knew she wanted to  give it bad, so I --
Sparks and goes out.
(looks up at light) That won't do. Man's gotta see what  he's doing. 'Scuse me.
Wayne heads off for the kitchen. The second he's gone...

Raises her hips and digs a hand into her pocket and pulls out her Swiss Army knife. She pries open the big blade. S hears Wayne sloshing back toward her. She gets back into position Wayne left her in as...
Re-enters carrying two burning candles in candle-holders.
I got the candles. All's we need is  a cake.
He sets the candles down on a dry step above Karen's head He leans in close.
Mood lighting. You in the mood yet? (no answer from Karen;  back into Penthouse  letter) And then she said, "My present's  ready and waiting. All's you gotta  do is unwrap it."

Wayne reaches into the water, undoes Karen's rain pants,  yanks off her shoes, then pulls off her pants. He throws  them over the banister. Karen remains passive, blank. Way takes off his holster; hangs it on the banister. Then he  pushes his pants down to his ankles. His shirttail is lon enough so that we don't have to see his wretched little  pecker. He climbs on top of Karen in the water, brings hi face close to hers.

It was cold and rainy that birthday  night, and all I wanted was to get  someplace warm and dry. As it turned  out, what I really wanted was  something warm and wet. Wayne grins  and closes for a kiss and...
Moves fast with the knife and...
Pop open wide.
His head jerks back. He tries to shout, but all that come out is an awful gurgle. He tries to push off Karen, but..
Wraps her legs around him, holds him close, pinning him.
Finally breaks free. He tries to stop the bleeding with a hand, but the blood spurts through his fingers. He reache for his gun in his holster on the banister, but just as h grabs it...
Lashes out of the water with her legs, kicking Wayne in t groin, pushing him back.
Tries to get his balance, but his feet can't move -- his  pants are around his ankles. He falls back into the water firing his pistol.
Blow chunks out of the wall next to Karen, hit the ceilin and...
Is floating on his back, trying to lift the pistol, but h strength is fading fast. He gets off one last shot and...
Nearest Karen is blown to pieces.
The gun drops into the water. No more shots. No more life He floats, pants around his ankles, covered in blood, dea
Happy Birthday, Wayne.
The church roof is on fire.
Are across the street.
Jim and Tom hear a creaking and look up.
The fire has eaten holes in the roof. Embers come down.
The Sheriff is getting very agitated.
They're not coming out, Hank!
The fire's not catching. The rain's  too --
We have to get them! We have to kill  them! Do you understand? If they're  not dead, we got jack shit!
A small chunk of burning ceiling drops down. Jim and Tom  look up. Just then...
Floods into the church through...
Filling the church with a kaleidoscope of colors.
Look out the windows.
My God they're beautiful.
Remain beautiful for a few more seconds until they shatte and blow inwards as...

text: Come crashing through.
Land, stop fast. The Sheriff's boat lands closer to the  pulpit; Hank's boat closer to the balcony.

Looking up through a tangle of floating pews at the waver silhouettes of the boats and the men in them against the  burning timbers above.

hit the deck in their boats, returning fire over the gunw

In the boat.

Hank?
(woozy but okay) It's topped out.

How should I know?
Guess!

(to the Sheriff) Get out of the boat.

No.
